In every sense I *do* feel that Ethereum's current implementation is a hacky workaround to solve a complex problem, which doesn't scale.
But it's very hard to prove + verify completion of general purpose computing tasks in a trustless manner, hence the Ethereum architecture.
A more sensible solution might be an off-network compute layer where all that's verified on-network is completion of said work.
But I agree, having *every node* run general purpose computation is wasteful and will not scale.
Like I said, security + redundancy. In the case of a financial ledger, that's really useful.
